Paris is the capital city of France and is known for its art, fashion, and culture.
Berlin is the capital of Germany, a country in Central Europe.
The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous landmarks in Paris, attracting millions of visitors every year.
France is a country located in Western Europe, bordered by Belgium, Germany, and Spain.
Madrid is the capital city of Spain and is famous for its vibrant nightlife.
The Louvre Museum in Paris is home to thousands of works of art, including the Mona Lisa.
The Seine River flows through Paris and adds to the city’s charm.
Rome is the capital city of Italy and is known for its ancient history and monuments.
Paris has been the capital of France since the 10th century.
France’s government, including the president’s official residence, is based in Paris.
London is the capital city of the United Kingdom and is known for its history and architecture.
The Colosseum in Rome is an ancient amphitheater and a symbol of the Roman Empire.
The Thames River flows through London, providing scenic views and transportation.
Barcelona is a city in Spain famous for its art and architecture, especially the works of Gaudí.
The Sagrada Família is a large unfinished basilica in Barcelona designed by Antoni Gaudí.
Amsterdam is the capital of the Netherlands and is known for its canals and museums.
The Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam houses a vast collection of Dutch art and history.
Vienna is the capital of Austria and is renowned for its classical music heritage.
The Danube River passes through Vienna, connecting it to other European cities.
Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic and is famous for its Old Town Square.
The Charles Bridge is a historic bridge that crosses the Vltava river in Prague.
Budapest is the capital of Hungary, divided by the Danube River into Buda and Pest.
The Parliament Building in Budapest is a notable example of Neo-Gothic architecture.
Lisbon is the capital of Portugal and is known for its hilly landscape and historic trams.
The Belém Tower is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in Lisbon.
Athens is the capital of Greece and is famous for its ancient monuments and ruins.
The Acropolis of Athens is an ancient citadel containing the Parthenon temple.
Brussels is the capital of Belgium and the de facto capital of the European Union.
The Atomium is a landmark building in Brussels, originally constructed for Expo 58.
Stockholm is the capital of Sweden and is built on 14 islands connected by bridges.
The Vasa Museum in Stockholm displays a 17th-century ship that sank on its maiden voyage.
Oslo is the capital of Norway and is known for its green spaces and museums.
The Oslo Opera House is an architectural landmark located at the harbor.
Copenhagen is the capital of Denmark and is famous for its cycling culture.
The Little Mermaid statue is a popular tourist attraction in Copenhagen.
Helsinki is the capital of Finland and is known for its design and seaside location.
The Helsinki Cathedral is a distinctive landmark in the city center.
Dublin is the capital of Ireland and is famous for its literary history.
The Guinness Storehouse in Dublin is a major tourist destination.
Edinburgh is the capital of Scotland and is known for its historic and cultural attractions.
Edinburgh Castle dominates the skyline from its position atop Castle Rock.
Warsaw is the capital of Poland and has a reconstructed Old Town after World War II.
The Royal Castle in Warsaw is a symbol of Polish history and culture.
Zurich is the largest city in Switzerland and a global financial center.
Lake Zurich offers recreational activities and scenic views in the city.
Moscow is the capital of Russia and is known for its Kremlin and Red Square.
Saint Basil's Cathedral in Moscow is famous for its colorful onion domes.
Istanbul is a major city in Turkey that straddles Europe and Asia.
The Hagia Sophia in Istanbul has served as a church, mosque, and museum.
Cairo is the capital of Egypt and is close to the ancient pyramids of Giza.
The Nile River flows through Cairo, providing water and transportation.
Beijing is the capital of China and is known for its modern architecture and ancient sites.
The Great Wall of China is a world-famous landmark near Beijing.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan and is known for its skyscrapers and pop culture.
Mount Fuji, near Tokyo, is Japan’s tallest mountain and a symbol of the country.
Seoul is the capital of South Korea and is famous for its technology and palaces.
Gyeongbokgung Palace is a historic royal palace in Seoul.
Bangkok is the capital of Thailand and is known for its vibrant street life.
The Grand Palace in Bangkok is a complex of buildings at the heart of the city.
New Delhi is the capital of India and is known for its diverse culture and history.
The Red Fort is a historic fortification in New Delhi and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
